newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh tea prices rise on higher demand.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh tea prices rise on higher demand.

text.p: Bangladeshi tea prices rose on demand from both local and overseas buyers at the weekly auction on Tuesday, brokers said.
Brokers said there was healthy tone in the market as buyers for Russia, Pakistan, Afghanistan and Sudan and Jordan operated strongly pushing the prices of most grades higher.

More than 1.12 million kg of teas were sold at the auction. The average tea price was 43.2 taka, up 1.18 from the previous sale. The next auction will be held on August 27 with an offer of 1.28 million kg of teas. ($1.0 = 42.15)
